author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.pli: “Sūriyassa, bhikkhave, udayato etaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ etaṃ pubbanimittaṃ, yadidaṃ—aruṇuggaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, the dawn is the forerunner and precursor of the sunrise.

segments.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ abhisamayāya etaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ etaṃ pubbanimittaṃ, yadidaṃ—sammādiṭṭhi.
segments.en: In the same way, right view is the forerunner and precursor of truly comprehending the four noble truths.
A mendicant with right view can expect to truly understand:

segments.pli: ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānissati … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānissati.
segments.en: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
segments.en: That’s why you should practice meditation …”

sections.title: “Mendicants, the dawn is the forerunner and precursor of…

suttaplex.blurb: As the dawn precedes the sunrise, right view precedes the penetration of the four  noble truths.
